div.p: Greetings. What my mind has long foreseen, alas, has come to pass today. Our Laurentius, to whom you will give full faith, will declare to you the lamentable event. I have given him testimonials to your magnificent magistrate, which you will undoubtedly see yourself.
That excellent brother of ours will narrate my successes. I cannot say more due to my sorrow. Ensure that my letters are well kept with the senate, so that my candor does not lead me into danger.
Farewell quickly from Schlachteck, August 21, 1556. Yours, Georg Frölich.
To Lord Heinrich Bullinger, Antistes of Zürich, a desired brother and friend.
